AdminChanged(address,address).details: Emitted when the admin account has changed.

BeaconUpgraded(address).details: Emitted when the beacon is upgraded.

Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

params.protocols_: The protocols that will be spending reserve tokens

returns.allowances_: The tokens that are approved for use by all the protocols

params.protocol_: The protocol to get the tokens for

returns.allowances_: The tokens that are approved for use by the protocol

params.protocol_: The protocol to get the tokens for

returns.result_: The tokens that are approved for use by the protocol

params._auths: The addresses that have the auth to approve and revoke protocol token allowances
params._rebalancers: The addresses that can execute a rebalance on a protocol
params.owner_: owner address is able to upgrade contract and update auth users

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

params.colToken0MinMax_: if vault supply is more than Liquidity Layer then deposit difference through reserve/rebalance contract
params.colToken1MinMax_: if vault supply is less than Liquidity Layer then withdraw difference to reserve/rebalance contract
params.debtToken0MinMax_: if vault borrow is more than Liquidity Layer then borrow difference to reserve/rebalance contract
params.debtToken1MinMax_: if vault borrow is less than Liquidity Layer then payback difference through reserve/rebalance contract
params.value_: any msg.value to send along (as fetched from resolver!)

rebalanceDexVaults(address[],uint256[],i.details: don't need onlyRebalancer modifier as it is already checked in `rebalanceDexVault` function

params.value_: any msg.value to send along (as fetched from resolver!)

rebalanceFTokens(address[],uint256[]).details: don't need onlyRebalancer modifier as it is already checked in `rebalanceFToken` function

params.value_: any msg.value to send along (as fetched from resolver!)

rebalanceVaults(address[],uint256[]).details: don't need onlyRebalancer modifier as it is already checked in `rebalanceVault` function

params.protocols_: The protocols that will no longer be spending reserve tokens

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.isAuth_: Whether or not the address should be an auth

params.isRebalancer_: Whether or not the address should be a rebalancer

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

withdrawFunds(address[],uint256[],addres.details: This function can only be called by the owner, which is always the Governance address

params.amounts_: The amounts of each token to withdraw
params.receiver_: The address to receive the withdrawn funds

LogAllow(address,address,uint256,uint256.notice: Emitted when a token is approved for use by a protocol

LogRevoke(address,address).notice: Emitted when a token is revoked for use by a protocol

LogTransferFunds(address).notice: Emitted whenever funds for a certain `token` are transfered to Liquidity

LogUpdateAuth(address,bool).notice: Emitted when an address is added or removed from the auths

LogUpdateRebalancer(address,bool).notice: Emitted when an address is added or removed from the rebalancers

LogWithdrawFunds(address,uint256,address.notice: Emitted whenever funds for a certain `token` are withdrawn to receiver

approve(address[],address[],uint256[]).notice: Approves protocols to spend the reserves tokens

getAllProtocolAllowances().notice: Gets the allowances that are approved to a protocol

getProtocolAllowances(address).notice: Gets the allowances that are approved to a protocol

getProtocolTokens(address).notice: Gets the tokens that are approved for use by a protocol

isAuth(address).notice: Maps address to there status as an Auth

isRebalancer(address).notice: Maps address to there status as a Rebalancer

nativeTokenAllowances(address).notice: Mapping of protocol addresses to the amount of tokens that are allowed to be used by that protocol

rebalanceDexVault(address,uint256,int256.notice: Executes a rebalance on a DEX vault protocol by calling that protocol's `rebalance` function

rebalanceFToken(address,uint256).notice: Executes a rebalance on a fToken protocol by calling that protocol's `rebalance` function

rebalanceVault(address,uint256).notice: Executes a rebalance on a vaultT1 protocol by calling that protocol's `rebalance` function

renounceOwnership().notice: override renounce ownership as it could leave the contract in an unwanted state if called by mistake.

revoke(address[],address[]).notice: Revokes protocols' ability to spend the reserves tokens

updateAuth(address,bool).notice: Updates an auth's status as an auth

updateRebalancer(address,bool).notice: Updates a rebalancer's status as a rebalancer

withdrawFunds(address[],uint256[],addres.notice: Withdraws funds from the contract to a specified receiver

userdoc.notice: This contract manages the approval of tokens for use by protocols and           the execution of rebalances on protocols
